intro: Gnaphalium grandiceps, commonly known as the giant cudweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and meadows. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense heads. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft appearance.
